body: :thinking: your mapping does look kind of weird to me too, I would expect it `DiscriminatorMap` to be defined on a class that is a parent of `Organisation`, `Customer` and `Supplier`. Cc @mpdude
We have a similar problem. This worked fine in 2.9.3.

Exactly the same problem here after upgrading to 2.9.4, despite the parent class being part of the DiscriminatorMap. Worked without problems in 2.9.3 and below. Converting the parent class to an abstract class per the advice solved the issue.
Please add better reproduce examples, the the report does not show Joined table or single table attributes.

> your mapping does look kind of weird to me too, I would expect it DiscriminatorMap to be defined on a class that is a parent of Organisation, Customer and Supplier.

Although it looks weird to me, it's what is documented at https://www.doctrine-project.org/projects/doctrine-orm/en/2.9/reference/inheritance-mapping.html#single-table-inheritance , (`Employee extends Person`), so this is definitely a regression, and we should have tests for this.

> Entity 'App\Entity\Organisation' has to be part of the discriminator map of 'App\Entity\Organisation' to be properly mapped in the inheritance hierarchy. Alternatively you can make 'App\Entity\Organisation' an abstract class to avoid this exception from occurring

Please provide the stack trace for this error. If you don't know how to get a stack trace, I wrote https://symfony.com/doc/current/contributing/code/stack_trace.html :slightly_smiling_face:

https://github.com/doctrine/orm/blob/b19a13f4edfaa5806109cd899f5912a7df1547b5/lib/Doctrine/ORM/Mapping/ClassMetadataFactory.php#L288

`in_array($class->name, $parent->discriminatorMap)` this should return `true` but doesn't I think. It would be great to get the return value of `dump($class->name, $parent->discriminatorMap)` (or use a debugger)

```
ClassMetadataFactory.php on line 289:
"App\Entity\Organisation"
ClassMetadataFactory.php on line 289:
[]

```
Ok, so the issue is indeed hereâ€¦ surely because it's used on `$parent`, which must be `BaseEntity`, which does not have a discriminator map.
I have isolated the bug based on the example in the docs in a unit test, see https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/8916

issue.title: Check current class' discriminator map
issue.body:
A class can be in its own discriminator map, as described in documentation example at
https://www.doctrine-project.org/projects/doctrine-orm/en/2.9/reference/inheritance-mapping.html#single-table-

Fixes #8914

# How can I test this?

```shell
composer config repositories.greg0ire vcs https://github.com/greg0ire/doctrine-orm
composer require doctrine/orm "dev-failing-test-8914 as 2.9.4"
```

body: In fact I think I have a fix.
